solution_line_template: The husband saves ${husband_weekly_savings} x {weeks_per_month} = $<<{husband_weekly_savings}*{weeks_per_month}={husband_monthly_savings}>>{husband_monthly_savings} a month.
The wife saves ${wife_weekly_savings} x {weeks_per_month} = $<<{wife_weekly_savings}*{weeks_per_month}={wife_monthly_savings}>>{wife_monthly_savings} a month.
Together, they save ${husband_monthly_savings} + ${wife_monthly_savings} = $<<{husband_monthly_savings}+{wife_monthly_savings}={couple_monthly_savings}>>{couple_monthly_savings} in a month.
In {saving_months} months, their total savings is ${couple_monthly_savings} x {saving_months} = $<<{couple_monthly_savings}*{saving_months}={total_savings}>>{total_savings}.
Half of the couple's savings is {total_savings} / {division_factor_half} = $<<{total_savings}/{division_factor_half}={half_savings}>>{half_savings}.
